review_text: This is a beautiful hidden gem! The home is located just a few minutes from Missouri Valley College. The home is nicely decorated and very clean. We saw lots of beautiful birds in a nest with perfectly blue robin eggs, a woodpecker, a baby skunk, squirrels and butterflies! It was very serene. The tree swing was so much fun, from our 2 year old Grandaughter when she came to visit to our 80 year old grandma! Lots of laughs for all. If you can respect the rules of the owners and appreciate the beauty all around, then this place is a must! Will definitely rent again when we return!

A nice place in a quiet farm area. Overall, a good place to stay for UCM graduation weekend. Just a few tips to note:
*If you have to get up in the middle of the night to use the restroom, the stairs can be a little tricky. Might not be the best place if you have mobility issues or get up frequently at night.
*The mattress is not the most comfortable (we are used to a Tempur-Pedic). You might also bing your own pillows...these are pretty flat.
*You might ask if they are currently experiencing a drought when you plan to go. If they are, obviously the pond will be low but more notably, the water inside the house will have a strong sulfur smell. This made any function associated with water an unpleasant experience. They did provide bottled water in the fridge, but you might want to bring a case if you drink a lot or plan to be there more than a few days.
